title: Something weird is going on?
body:
So I opened up league today and it had an update. So as it was installing, my antivirus alerted me that a file called Pua.Safe.Install was inside the update. My antivirus removed it and I tried re-downloading the update. Unfortunately, it kept popping up with an error. I restarted my computer and I uninstalled league of legends from my computer. I waited a bit and reinstalled it, only for it to say there was another error.
Please let me know if this is something with the alpha client or if its my computer itself.

replies.body:
What anti virus are you using?  You may need to configure your antivirus and other settings to allow league as an exception, which our[ patching issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues) guide to help with.  

The part that sucks if you've already had the file removed, in which case a repair would be necessary.  That function can be found through the gear icon of the main patcher screen.  I hope this helps fix things up!

My antivirus is Webroot I believe because I'm away from my computer right now, and I've never had a problem with league and my antivirus. It was just this one update. I don't want to do something that'll possibly cause harm to my computer.

Yeah, we've seen reports of Webroot Secure Anywhere treating League as an unknown source after the patch update.  Allowing league as an exception should fix that up!  I haven't seen too many reports since then so I'm guessing that the software has since updated to no longer detect a false positive.  Let me know if that clears things up!

Same exact thing is happening with me.  Doesn't matter if i re download it still gives me error.  I use webroot but I've used this anti virus for over 2 years and no issues like this ever.

I tell it to repair and all i get is multiple retry's from the client. :(
Your fire wall just doesn't like the file, just go into your firewall and tell it to accept the file.
